poem:
**Tracks of Progress**  

Public chains now linked, not sold,  
Steel veins pump stories bold.  
In Parliament's echoing halls,  
Iron horses break old stalls.  
King's word reclaims the rail of yore,  
Union chants give engines roar.  
No more profiteering's veil,  
For we, the people, ride the rail.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Unions hail UK’s rail renationalisation bills as a return to ‘public service’ Rail unions have said Britain’s trains will be “run as a public service, not for private profit”, as the new government announced early steps to renationalise the railways in the king’s speech. Labour will renationalise rail with two separate bills, decoupling laws to take train services into public ownership from more complex legislation to set up a dedicated public body, Great British Railways". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Unions hail UK’s rail renationalisation bills as a return to ‘public service’ Rail unions have said Britain’s trains will be “run as a public service, not for private profit”, as the new government announced early steps to renationalise the railways in the king’s speech. Labour will renationalise rail with two separate bills, decoupling laws to take train services into public ownership from more complex legislation to set up a dedicated public body, Great British Railways
